intro: Sericanthe chevalieri var. chevalieri, commonly known as the Chevalier's sericanthe, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its striking appearance and limited distribution, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
